TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S.J. RES. 54 (APP. 2/8/1924) CANCELING LEASE EXECUTED APR. 7, 1922 BY THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, ALBERT B. FALL, AND THE HON. EDWIN DENBY, SECRETARY OF THE NAVY, ACTING FOR THE UNITED STATES AND THE MAMMOTH OIL COMPANY, REPREENTED BY HARRY SINCLAIR, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY MODIFYING THE WORDING OF THE FIRST PARAGRAPH OF THE AMENDMENT BY INSERTING "THE OIL LEASES WERE EXECUTED UNDER CIRCUMSTANCES GIVING RISE TO SERIOUS QUESTIONS OF LEGALITY"
TO AMEND S.J. RES. 54, BY STATING THAT THE LEASES WERE MADE WITHOUT "APPARENT" AUTHORITY INSTEAD OF "WITHOUT AUTHORITY". (P. 1607-1, 1685-1)

TO AMEND S.J. RES. 54, BY STATING THAT THE LEASES WERE MADE BY THE THEN SECRETARY OF INTERIOR, ALBERT B. FALL, AND HON. EDWIN DENBY, SECRETARY OF THE NAVY, IN CONTRAVENTION OF THE POLICY OF THE GOVERNMENT INSTEAD OF IN DEFIANCE OF THAT POLICY.  (P. 1607-, 1685-2)

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S.J. RES. 54, WHICH AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE PRESIDENT TO TAKE THE NECESSARY LEGAL STEPS TO CANCEL LEASES MENTIONED IN ORIGINAL RES., TOGATHER WITH THE LEASES OF THE AMERICAN PETROLEUM AND TRANSPORT CO. AND THE PAN AMEICAN PETROLEUM CO., AND TO PROSECUTE CIVILLY AND CRIMINALLY AN TO TAKE SUCH OTHER ACTIONS, AS MAY BE WARRENTED BY THE FACTS REGARDING THE MAKING OF THE LEASES BY THE THEN SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, ALBERT B
TO PASS S.J. RES. 54.  (P. 1728-2)

TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR, APPEALED FROM BY KENNETH D. MCKELLER (D. TENN.) A MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. RES. 134, PROVIDING THAT THE PRESIDENT IMMEDIATELY REQUEST THE RESIGNATION OF EDWIN DENBY AND ALL OTHER OFFICIALS AND OFFICERS N THE NAVY DEPARTMENT WHOSE CONNECTION WITH THE LEASING OF THE OIL RESERVES OF THE GOVERNMENT INDICATES MISFEASANCE OR MALFEASANCE IN OFFICE, WHICH DECISION HELD THAT THE UNANIMOUS CONSENT AGREEMENT ALLOWED A SENATOR TO TALK FOR 10 MINUTES ON EACH AMENDME...
TO AMEND S. RES. 134, BY ADDING A CLAUSE THAT SUCH REQUEST BE MADE ONLY IF HE BE QUILTY OF MALFEASANCE OR MISFEASANCE IN OFFICE.  (P. 2244-1)

TO AMEND S. RES. 134, BY ADDING THAT IN VIEW OF THE DISCLOSURES MADE AND FACTS ASCERTAINED IN CONNECTION WITH THE OIL LEASE INVESTIGATION NOW IN PROGRESS, IT IS THE SENSE OF THE SENATE THAT THE PUBLIC INTERESTS WOULD BE SERVED BY THE SAID RESIGNATIONS.  &9 2244-2)
TO PASS S. RES. 134.  (P. 1547-2)
TO TRANSMIT A COPY OF S. RES. 134 TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES.
CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF LIENT. COL. DUNCAN K. MAJOR, JR. TO BE COLONEL OF INFANTRY IN THE REGULAR ARMY.  (P. 2476)

TO CONSIDER THE NOMINATION, IN OPEN SESSION, OF ATLEE POMERENE (OHIO) AND OWEN J. ROBERTS (PENN.) TO BE SPECIAL CONSUEL TO HAVE CHARGE AND CONTROL OF THE PROSECUTION OF LITIGATION IN CONNECTION WITH CERTAIN LEASES OF IOL LANDS AND INCIDENTAL CONTRACTS, A PROVIDED IN S.J
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF ATLEE POMERENE. (P. 2547-1)
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF OWEN J. ROBERTS. (P. 2547-1)

TO DECIDE THE POINT OF ORDER RAISED IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE BY LEE S. OVERMAN (D. N.C.) WHILE CONSIDERING H.R. 5078 (APP. 6/5/1924), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1925, WHICH POINT BING THAT APPROPRIATIONS FOR HOWARD UNIVERSITY EMBRACE ITEMS THAT HAVE NEVER BEEN AUTHORIZED BY CONGRESS, AND THEREFORE, CONSTITUTE NEW LEFISLATION WHICH THE COMMITTEE ON APPROPRIATIONS HAD NO AUTHORITY TO REPORT

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT AS AMENDED IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO H.R. 5078, WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE APPROPRIATION OF $515,000 FOR CONTINUATION OF CONSTRUCTION, OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF A HYDRO-ELECTRIC PLANT AT YUMA, ARIZ.-CALIF, THE CHARGE FOR CONSTUCTION TO BE BORNE BY THE PROJECT AND NOT BY THE CONSUMER
TO DECIDE WHETHER THE AMENDMENT OF IRVIN L. LENROOT IS GERMANE OR RELEVANT TO H.R. 5078, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES AN APPROPRIATION OF $370,000 FOR HOWARD UNIVERSITY. (P. 3093-2, 3153-1)

TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR, A MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5078, WHICH DECISION HELD THAT THE AMENDMENT APPROPRIATING MONEY TO HOWARD UNIVERSITY WAS RELEVANT.  (P. 3154-1, 3156-2)

TO PASS S. RES. 157, DIRECTING THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY TO INVESTIGATE THE FAILURE OF ATTORNEY GENERAL HARRY M. DOUGHERTY TO PROSECUTE OR DEFEND CERTAIN CRIMINAL AND CIVIL ACTIONS WHEREIN THE GOVERNMENT IS INTERESTED. (P. 3409-2)

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6349 (APP. 4/4/1924), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE TREASURY AND POST OFFICE DEPARTMENTS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1925, WHICH AMENDMENT INCREASES THE AMOUNT APPROPRIATED FOR HIRE OF MOTOR PROPELLED, PASENGER CARRYING VEHICLES FROM $3,680,140 TO $16,180,140

TO AGREE TO THE MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 2250, A BILL TO PROMOTE A PERMANENT SYSTEM OF SELF-SUPPORTING AGRICULTURE IN REGIONS ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY THE STIMULATION OF WHEAT PRODUCTION DURING THE WAR AND AGGRAVATED BY MANY YEARS OF SMALL YIELDS AND HIGH PODUCTION COSTS OF WHEAT, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE PRESIDENT BE AUTHORIZED AND DIRECTED TO PROCURE SUCH STOCKS OF NITRATE OF SODA AND CALCIUM ARSENATE AS HE MAY DETERMINE TO BE NECESSARY FOR INCREASING AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION
TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF S.J. RES. 60, STIMULATING CROP PRODUCTION IN THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND S. 2250, BY AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE TO SET UP A SYSTEM FOR SINGLE CROP PRODUCERS, TO APPLY PARTICULARLY IN WHEAT AREAS AND AREAS NOT WHOLLY RESTRICTED TO SINGLE CROPS, BUT THOSE WHICH WOULD INCLUDE THE RAISING OF LIVESTOCK, SUCHAS SAIRY AND BEEF CATTLE, HOGS, SHEEP, POULTRY AND THE PRODUCTS THEREOF
TO AMEND S. 2250, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION LIMITING THE AMOUNT OF THE APPROPRIATION THAT CAN BE EXPENDED DURING 1924, 1925 AND 1926.  (P. 3962-2)
TO RECOMMIT S. 2250 TO THE COMMITTEE ON AGRICULTURE AND FORESTRY.  (P. 3963-1,2)

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 2250, WHICH AMENDMENT ADDS TO THE APPROPRIATION IN THE BILL OF $50,000,000 FOR WHEAT AREAS, AN APPROPRIATION OF $25,000,000 TO CARRY OUT THE PROVISIONS OF THE BILL IN OTHER AREAS.  (P. 1776-1, 3962-1)

TO AMEND S. 2250, BY PROVIDING THAT THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE, IN EXECUTING THE FUNCTIONS VESTED IN HIM BY THIS ACT, SHALL, SO FAR AS PRACTICABLE, UTILIZE THE FEDERAL INTERMEDIATE CREDIT BANK SYSTEM, AND THAT THE DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS OF SAID BANKS, ND THE FEDERAL FARM LOAN BOARD, SHALL COOPERATE WITH THE SECRETARY FOR SUCH PURPOSE
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND GREAT BRITAIN TO AID IN THE PREVENTION OF THE SMUGGLING OF INTOXICATING LIQUORS INTO THE U.S. (P. 4084-2, 4085-1)

TO AMEND S. 2250, BY PROVIDING THAT THE DIRECTIONS TO THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE TO UTILIZE, SO FAR AS PRACTICABLE, THE FEDERAL INTERMEDIATE BANKS SYSTEM, BE MADE MANDATORY INSTEAD OF PERMISSIVE.  (P. 4083-2, 4084-1)

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S.J. RES. 22, PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION OF THE UNITED STATES FIXING THE COMMENCEMENT OF THE TERMS OF PRESIDENT AND VICE-PRESIDENT AND MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND FIXING THE TIME OF THE ASSEMBLY OF CONGRESS, BY PROVIDNG THAT THE TERM OF OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT SHALL BE FOUR YEARS, IN LIEU OF SIX YEARS, AND NO PERSON HEREAFTER ELECTED SHALL BE ELIGIBLE TO RE-ELECTION

TO AMEND S.J. RES. 22, BY ADDING A PROVISION THAT THE EXECUTIVE POWER SHALL BE VESTED IN THE PRESIDENT, WHO SHALL HOLD OFFICE FOR SIX YEARS, AND NO PERSON HEREAFTER ELECTED SHALL BE ELIGIBLE TO RE-ELECTION.  (P. 4326-1,2, 4327-1)
TO PASS S.J. RES. 22.  (P. 4418-2)
TO CONSIDER S.J. RES. 4, PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION OF THE UNITED STATES RELATIVE TO THE ADOPTION OF AMENDMENTS THERETO.  (P. 4420-1)

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT AS AMENDED, TO H.R. 5078, MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1925, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR AN APPROPRIATION OF $100,000 FOR THE PURCHASE OF BRIGHT ANGEL TOLL ROAD, WTHIN THE GRAND CANYON NATIONAL PARK, TO BE IMMEDIATELY AVAILABLE AND REMAIN AVAILABLE UNTIL EXPENDED, PROVIDED NO PURCHASE SHALL BE MADE OF SAID TRAIL UNTIL THE PEOPLE OF COCONINO COUNTY, ARIZONA, SHALL HAVE RATIFIED SAID PURCHASE BY VOTE AT AN ELECTION

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT AS AMENDED TO H.R. 5078, WHICH AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES $100,000 FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF TRAILS WITHIN THE GRAND CANYON NATIONAL PARK, TO BE IMMEDIATELY AVAILABLE AND TO REMAIN AVAILABLE UNTIL EXPENDED, PROVIDED SAID SUM MAY BE USD BY THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR FOR THE PURCHASE FROM THE COUNTY OF COCONINO, ARIZONA, OF THE BRIGHT ANGEL TOLL ROAD AND TRAIL WITHIN THE SAID PARK, ON SUCH TERMS AND CONDITIONS AS HE MAY DEEM PROPER, AND THAT HE IS AUTHORIZED TO CONSTRUCT AN APPROACH ...

TO ADOPT THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC LANDS AND SURVEYS, AND DIRECT THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE TO CERTIFY TO THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA THE FACTS REPORTED THEREIN, A MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. RES. 147, PROVIDNG FOR INVESTIGATION OF NAVAL OIL RESERVES LAND LEASES

TO AGREE TO S. RES. 195, PROVIDING THAT A COPY OF THE TESTIMONY ADDUCED AND THE PROCEEDINGS HAD BEFORE THE COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC LANDS AND SURVEYS UNDER SENATE RES. 147, WITH A COPY OF THIS RESOLUTION, BE TRANSMITTED TO THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES FOR SUC PROCEEDINGS AGAINST CLARENCE C

TO AMEND S.J. RES. 4, PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION OF THE UNITED STATES RELATIVE TO THE ADOPTION OF AMENDMENTS THEREOF, BY PROPOSING THAT CONGRESS, WHENEVER TWO-THIRDS OF BOTH HOUSES SHALL DEEM IT NECESSARY, SHALL PROPOSE AMENDMENTS TO THISCONSTITUTION, OR UPON THE APPLICATION OF TWO-THIRDS OF THE LEGISLATURES OF THE SEVERAL STATES, SHALL CALL A CONVENTION FOR PROPOSING AMENDMENTS, WHICH SHALL BE VALID AND TO ALL INTENTS AND PURPOSES BE PART OF THIS CONSTITUTION WHEN RATIFIED BY A VOTE OF T...

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDED AMENDMENT TO S.J. RES. 4, WHICH AMENDED AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT CONGRESS, WHENEVER TWO-THIRDS OF EACH HOUSE SHALL DEEM IT NECESSARY, SHALL PROPOSE AMENDMENTS TO THIS CONSTITUTION, OR UPON THE APPLICATION OF TWO-THIRDS OF THE LEGISATURES OF THE SEVERAL STATES, SHALL CALL A CONVENTION FOR PROPOSING AMENDMENTS, WHICH SHALL BE VALID AND TO ALL INTENTS AND PURPOSES BE PART OF THIS CONSTITUTION WHEN RATIFIED BY A VOTE OF THE QUALIFIED ELECTORS IN THREE-FOURTHS OF THE SEVERAL STATES THRO...

TO AMEND S.J. RES. 4, BY STRIKING OUT ON P. 3 LINE 1, AFTER THE WORD "CASE," THE WORDS "SHALL BE SUBMITTED TO THE LEGISLATURES OF THE SEVERAL STATES AND," AND AFTER THE WORD "STATES" IN LINE 4, THE WORDS "AFTER AFFIRMATIVE OR NEGATIVE ACTION BY RESPECTIV LEGISLATURES," AND STRIKING OUT THE JONES AMENDMENT
TO RECOMMIT S.J. RES. 4 TO THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE. (P. 5007-2, 5009-1)

TO AMEND S. 5, A BILL TO GRANT PENSIONS AND INCREASE OF PENSIONS TO CERTAIN SOLDIERS AND SAILORS OF THE CIVIL AND MEXICAN WARS AND TO CERTAIN WIDOWS, FORMER WIDOWS, MINOR CHILDREN, AND HELPLESS CHILDREN OF SAID SOLDIERS AND SAILORS, AND TO WIDOWS OF THE AR OF 1812, AND TO CERTAIN INDIAN WAR VETERANS AND WIDOWS, AND TO CERTAIN SPANISH WAR SOLDIERS, AND CERTAIN MAIMED SOLDIERS, BY PROVIDING THAT THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE ACT BE JULY 1, 1925

TO PASS S. 5, A BILL GRANTING PENSIONS AND INCREASE OF PENSIONS TO CERTAIN SOLDIERS AND SAILORS OF THE CIVIL AND MEXICAN WARS, AND TO CERTAIN WIDOWS, FORMER WIDOWS, MINOR CHILDREN, AND HELPLESS CHILDREN OF SAID SOLDIERS AND SAILORS, AND TO WIDOWS OF THE AR OF 1812, AND TO CERTAIN INDIAN WAR VETERANS AND WIDOWS, AND TO CERTAIN SPANISH WAR VETERANS, AND CERTAIN MAIMED SOLDIERS

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8233 (APP. 6/7/1924), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE EXECUTIVE OFFICE AND SUNDRY INDEPENDENT EXECUTIVE BUREAUS, BOARDS, COMMISSIONS, AND OFFICES FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1925, WHICH AMENDMENT ELIMINATES HE PROVISION THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIATION BE USED TO PAY THE SALARY OF ANY MEMBER OF THE UNITED STATES TARIFF COMMISSION HEREAFTER PARTICIPATING IN ANY PROCEEDINGS UNDER CERTAIN SECTIONS OF THE ACT, APPROVED SEPT

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 2576, A BILL LIMITING THE IMMIGRATION OF ALIENS INTO THE UNITED STATES, WHICH AMENDMENT CHANGES LINE 7, PAGE 5 IN THE BILL, THUS ALLOWING ENTRY OF AN ALIEN UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF AN AGREEMENT RELATING SOLELY TO IMMIGRATIO, AS WELL AS BY TREATY

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 2576, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT NO ALIEN INELIGIBLE FOR CITIZENSHIP BE ADMITTED UNDER THE NON-IMMIGRANT PROVISIONS UNLESS QUALIFIED FOR AT LEAST TWO YEARS PREVIOUS IN A VOCATION OF A RELIGIOUS OR AN EDUCATIONAL NATURE,OR A STUDENT OVER 18 YEARS OF AGE, EACH ENTERING SOLELY TO CARRY ON IN CHURCH OR SCHOOL; UNLESS SUCH ALIEN IS THE WIFE OR THE UNMARRIED CHILD UNDER 18 YEARS OF AGE OF AN ADMISSIBLE IMMIGRANT AND IS ACCOMPANYING OR FOLLOWING TO JOIN HIM

TO AMEND S. 2576, BY PROVIDING THAT FOR A PERIOD OF FIVE YEARS, BEGINNING SIXTY DAYS AFTER THE PASSAGE OF THIS ACT, THE IMMIGRATION OF ALIENS INTO THE UNITED STATES BE PROHIBITED.  (P. 6472-2, 6473-2)
TO AMEND S. 2576, BY PROVIDING THAT THE IMMIGRATION QUOTA COMPUTED ON CENSUS OF 1910 BE INCREASED FROM 2 PER CENTUM TO 3 PER CENTUM.  (P. 6474-2, 6538-1)
TO AMEND S. 2576, BY REDUCING THE IMMIGRATION QUOTA OF THE 1910 CENSUS FROM 2 PER CENTUM TO 1 PER CENTUM. (P. 6538-1, 6539-1)
TO AMEND S. 2576, SO AS TO STRIKE OUT "1910" ON LINE 13 PAGE 12 AND TO INSERT "1890" AND ADOPT THE PRESIDENTS REQUEST. (P. 6540-2, 6546-2, 6547-1)

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE AMENDING THE AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE ON IMMIGRATION TO S. 2576, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE QUOTA WAS FIXED AT 1 PER CENTUM OF THE 1910 CENSUS INSTEAD OF 2 PER CENTUM OF THE 1910 CENSUS. (P. 6547-2, 6548-2)
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2576, BY PROVIDING THAT THE IMMIGRATION QUOTA OF THE 1910 CENSUS BE REDUCED FROM 2 PER CENTUM, TO 1 PER CENTUM.  (P. 6548-2, 6549-1)

TO AMEND S. 2576, BY PROVIDING THAT PREFERENCE BE GIVEN TO SKILLED FARMERS AND FARM LABORERS BY CONSULS AFTER APPROVAL BY THE SECRETARY OF LABOR WITH THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE UPON THE REQUEST FOR SUCH WORKERS BY THE LEGISLATURE OR GOVERNOR OF A STATETO FILL A SPECIFIED NEED
TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 2576, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT PREFERENCE BE GIVEN TO SKILLED FARMERS AND EXPERIENCED FARM LABORERS IN THE ISSUANCE OF VISA CERTIFICATES.

TO AMEND S. 2576, BY PROVIDING THAT AN ALIEN MUST HAVE RESIDED CONTINUOUSLY FOR AT LEAST FIVE YEARS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE TIME OF HIS VERIFIED APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION TO THE UNITED STATES IN A FOREIGN CONTIGUOUS TERRITORY AND MUST BE AUTHORIZED BY HE SECRETARY OF LABOR UPON SUCH APPLICATION, TO BE ADMITTED FOR THE PURPOSE OF LABORING AT A SPECIAL OCCUPATION FOR A DEFINITE TIME AT A DESIGNATED PLACE; PROVIDED NOT MORE THAN 5,000 SUCH ALIENS SHALL BE WITHIN THE UNITED STATES AT ANY ONE TIME

TO AMEND H.R. 7959 (43 ST. 121, 5/19/1924), A BILL PROVIDING ADJUSTED COMPENSATION FOR VETERANS OF THE WORLD WAR, BY STIPULATING THAT THE RATE OF DISCOUNT BY THE FEDERAL RESERVE BANK ON THE PROMISSORY NOTES SECURED BY ADJUSTED-SERVICE CERTIFICATES, AS PRVIDED IN SECTION 502, SHALL NOT EXCEED A RATE OF 2 PER CENTUM PER ANNUM
TO AMEND H.R. 7959, BY ALLOWING LOANS ON SERVICE CERTIFICATES AT AN INTEREST NOT TO EXCEED 4 1/2%. (P. 6954-2, 6955-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 7959, BY STIPULATING THAT THE INTEREST RATE BE KEPT AT A FLAT 6 PER CENT PER ANNUM, WHEN A SOLDIER BORROWS ON HIS CERTIFICATE.  (P. 6955-2, 6956-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 7959, BY PROVIDING THAT IF THE VETERAN HAS DIED BEFORE MAKING APPLICATION UNDER SECTION 302, OR, IF ENTITLED TO RECEIVE ADJUSTED SERVICE PAY, HAS DIED AFTER MAKING APPLICATION BEFORE HE HAS RECEIVED PAYMENT UNDER TITLE IV, THEN THE AMOUNT O HIS ADJUSTED SERVICE CREDIT SHALL BE PAID TO HIS DEPENDENTS
TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, H.R. 7959, BY PERMITTING AN OPTION SO THAT THE EX-SERVICE MEN MAY ELECT TO RECEIVE IN CASH, THE AMOUNT OF MONEY TO WHICH THEY ARE ENTITLED.  (P. 6783-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 7959, BY PROVIDING THAT EACH OVERSEAS VETERAN MAY, AT HIS OPTION, RECEIVE $50.00 IN CASH AS PAYMENT TO BE DEDUCTED FROM HIS ADJUSTED-SERVICE CERTIFICATE. (P. 6969-1,2)
TO PASS H.R. 7959.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT, AS AMENDED, TO H.R. 6715 (APP. 6/2/1924, 43 STAT. L. 253), A BILL TO REDUCE AND EQUALIZE TAXES, AND TO PROVIDE REVENUES, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES CERTAIN LIMITS ON DEDUCTIONS IN THE PAYMENT OF INCOME TAXES IN RESPECT TO THE AMONT OF LOSSES AND AMOUNT OF INTEREST TO BE DEDUCTED
TO AMEND H.R. 6715, BY PROVIDING THAT THE INCOME TAX RETURNS FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE BUREAU OF THE GOVERNMENT BE MADE OPEN TO EXAMINATION AND INSPECTION. (P. 7676-1, 7692-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 6715, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL CLAIMS FOR ABATEMENT OR REFUNDS OF TAXES, INCLUDING THE DECISIONS, SHALL BE SUBJECT TO INSPECTION BY THE PUBLIC. (P. 7692-1, 7693-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 6715, BY PROVIDING THAT THE SALARY OF A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TAX APPEALS SHALL BE $7,500 INSTEAD OF $10,000.  (P. 7695-2)

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6715, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES AN ASSESSMENT OF 10 PER CENT TAX ON RADIO RECEIVING SETS, AND PARTS AND ACCESSORIES FOR SAME, SOLD OR LEASED TO ANY PERSON OTHER THAN A MANUFACTURER OR PRODUCER OF SUCH SETS.  (P. 7697-2)

TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, H.R. 6715, BY PROVIDING THAT IN ADDITION TO THE NORMAL TAX THERE SHALL BE LEVIED, COLLECTED AND PAID UPON THE NET INCOME OF EVERY INDIVIDUAL, A GRADUATED SURTAX UPON NET INCOMES RANGING FROM $10,000 TO $500,000, 1PER CENT TO 40 PER CENT OF SUCH EXCESS

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6715, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT IN LIEU OF THE TAX IMPOSED BY SECTION 211 OF THE REVENUE ACT OF 1921, BUT IN ADDITION TO THE NORMAL TAX IMPOSED BY SECTION 210 OF THIS ACT, THERE SHALL BE LEVIED, COLLECTED, AND PAID FR EACH TAXABLE YEAR UPON THE NET INCOME OF EVERY INDIVIDUAL, A GRADUATED SURTAX UPON NET INCOMES RANGING FROM $10,000 TO $500,000, 1 PER CENT TO 40 PER CENT OF SUCH EXCESS
TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, H.R. 6715, BY PROVIDING A GRADUATED TAX ON INDIVIDUAL NORMAL INCOME TAXES. (P. 7850-2)

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 2257, (APP. 6/7/1924, 43 STAT. L. 607), A BILL TO CONSOLIDATE, CODIFY, REVISE AND REENACT THE LAWS AFFECTING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE UNITED STATES VETERANS BUREAU AND THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE WAR RISK INSURANCE ACT, AS AENDED, AND THE VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION ACT, AS AMENDED, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO FIX THE SALARY OF THE DIRECTOR OF THE VETERANS BUREAU AT $10,000 INSTEAD OF $12,000
